title: Ticket #6105: Make use of classad cache be more explicit and cheaper
description:
When the classad cache is passed an expr-tree, it will unparse it. This is a fairly expensive operation and something that we never actually want to do in our code. so to insure that it isn't happening that capability will be removed from the classad cache.

Since this will involve an ABI change to the Classad code, some other changes will be rolled into the same commit. In particular.

  • The classad library version will be bumped
  • Classad cache insertion will be via explicit call InsertViaCache
  • Creation of common Literals will have optimized methods
  • Splitting of a single line of -long (old form) classad will be moved out of the classad library and into the compat layer
  • Trivial constructors and destructors for ExprTree, Literal and Value classes will be moved into the header files to insure that they are inlined.
  • The number factor will be moved from the Literal into the Value, where it packs better, but it will still be exposed through the Literal methods and not the Value methods (they are already friends...)
  • The parentScope will be moved from ExprTree into child classes other than Literal
remarks:
2017-Feb-02 14:36:59 by jfrey:
Removing the parentScope pointer from Literal nodes resulted in a 2% reduction in memory usage on a collector with 10,000 machine ads.

2017-Feb-10 12:14:34 by johnkn:
